main.name: Zaitech Development
main.description: Backend, Mobile and Embedded Systems Development
main.bio:
We currently are designing, developing, and scaling sophisticated e-commerce platforms. Our partnership with a leading Dutch retailer has been particularly impactful, where We've leveraged our expertise to not only scale the platform to handle hundreds of thousands of orders but also to significantly boost its revenue into the tens of millions. A notable accomplishment was expanding the platform's operations from the Netherlands to Belgium, transforming it into a versatile, multi-lingual, and multi-country system.

One of our key milestones was leading the scaling of a product from less than ten devices to over 230,000. This challenging task involved building core systems and abstraction layers to integrate new manufacturers and creating robust monitoring services. Crucially, we were instrumental in transitioning the company’s POS systems from Linux to Android, a move that has demonstrated our proficiency in managing extensive technology adaptations and enhancing system scalability.

Our founder has academic qualifications including an engineering degree from the University of Brasilia. His work in robotics has garnered international recognition, further underscoring his technical prowess. Additionally, we are passionate about mentorship and education, dedicating time as a Software Engineering Mentors at adplist.org, where we guide and nurture the next generation of software engineers.
main.contactmessage: Contact me if you think we can somehow make your life, my life and the world evolve

resume.skillmessage: Always interested in working with new technologies but for now these are the ones that have won me over
resume.progsmessage: Always interested in working with new technologies but for now these are the ones that have won me over

education.description:
Here I was dragged through a rigorous education and learning experience to embed skills that are crucial to success not only as an engineer, but also as a businessman, communicator, leader and even as a person
Discovered my affection for Control Systems and Automation and that affection got me many good results in the projects and subjects related to these areas

work.title: Lead Software Engineer
work.description:
Leading a team of four software developers, responsible for the design, development, and maintenance of the ecommerce platform of a big Dutch retailer. 
Since I started as the lead engineer, the platform has processed hundreds of thousands of orders, generating tens of millions in revenue. 
A key achievement during my leadership was expanding the platform beyond the Netherlands to include Belgium, overcoming significant hurdles to transform the platform into a multi-lingual, multi-country system. To accomplish this, I extensively modified the platform's code design and implemented new features to cater to the different market requirements, including tax systems differences. 
Keywords: GCP, Golang, Backend, Docker, CI/CD, E-Commerce.

work.title: Software Engineer
work.description:
Reduced eight hours of the time it takes the machine to be ready for production, in order to accomplish that, I adapted the machine calibration & performance procedures to receive the data from a ready file instead of running manual calibration from zero. 
The data file was a result of many significant alignments and agreements with multiple different stakeholders.
Keywords: Python, C, Unit test, C++, Documentation

work.title: Software Engineer
work.description:
Built and scaled a product from less than ten devices to +230k devices actively used by the clients, in order to accomplish that, I implemented CI pipelines, integrated new manufacturers, and developed monitoring services. 
The company's POS (Point Of Sale) devices were mainly based on Linux and I joined the new team responsible for introducing the Android-based POS to the market and scaling it.
Keywords: Kotlin, Android, Architecture, Unit test, C, Coroutines, Agile, Pair-programming

work.title: Consultant Software Engineer
work.description:
Optimized the position-detection (floor) system time response to take one-quarter of the original time, in order to accomplish this, I developed from scratch a production-grade machine learning backend service for position- detection in order to substitute the old system based on asp.net. 
Also, I had to deal with legacy systems and processes on a very diverse stack, like refactoring an Android app written in Java to Kotlin following the clean architecture concepts as well as implementing unit and instrumentation tests. 
Keywords: Python, CI/CD, DevOps, Flask, Backend, Docker, Machine Learning

work.title: Software Developer
work.description:
Solved the problem of parallel parsing and rendering of the health records which at least halved the time needed to parse the health records of each patient, in order to accomplish this I had to refactor the application to use Javascript promises, and align with the backend team on multiple matters like pagination and requests load. 
Also, I worked on the backend implementation of FHIR using HAPI (an open-source implementation of FHIR) and deployed it to an internal staging server for validation purposes, the works were done mainly in Spring Boot Kotlin. 
Keywords: React Native, EHR, Javascript, Agile, HL7, FHIR

work.title: Embedded Software Engineer
work.description:
Implemented automated tests and added new features for the hardware which was a cryptographic chip that could be used in any device that has an SD card slot, the main client of this product was the Brazilian Air Force. 
More details cannot be disclosed due to the signed NDA.

experience.title: Robotics Developer
experience.description: Robotics competition team representing the University of Brasilia at national and international events in which I participated in developing many robots

experience.title: Researcher
experience.description:
•     Scientific research about secure telecommunication, non-linear systems and chaotic circuits. Chaos-based analog cryptography is a subject that has attracted the attention of many researchers in academia and industry. This interest is motivated by the possibility of generating seemingly random signals using chaotic oscillators that can be defined from deterministic ordinary differential equations
     •     A research project financed by a GPS tracking company, working in the division responsible of creating a systemic simulator in Python for their satellites and tracking systems

experience.title: Captain  (Tech Leader)
experience.description: Led a team of 6 members and managed our integration with many experienced professors of our university to develop a robot to participate in Latin American Robotics Competition (LARC - 2018) In João Pessoa (Brazil). The result was 4th place

awardsAndPubs.title: Honorable Mention
awardsAndPubs.description: Participated in a research project for the Scientific Initiation Program (PIBIC). My topic; ”CIRCUITO CAÓTICO DE SPROTT-K SUBATUADO PARA TELECOMUNICAÇÃO COM SEGURANÇA” was nominated for the highlight of the year and obtained the honorable mention

awardsAndPubs.title: 3rd Place (worldwide)
awardsAndPubs.description:
The world's largest open robot competition (according to the Guinness Book of World Records)
The main challenge of this contest is to build an autonomous computer-controlled robot that can find its way through an arena that represents a model house, find a lit candle that represents a fire in the house, and extinguish the fire in the shortest time. This task simulates the real-world operation of an autonomous robot performing a fire protection function in a real house. The goal of the contest is to advance robot technology and knowledge while using robotics as an educational tool

awardsAndPubs.title: 2nd Place (worldwide)
awardsAndPubs.description:
The world's largest open robot competition (according to the Guinness Book of World Records)
Robots are programmed to find as many small tubes as possible in the event arena and move them onto a designated target area

testimonials.text: I worked with Abdullah between july 2017 and december 2018 inside the DROID. He was my supervisor during the IEEE-SEK/LARC 2017 and I worked directly with him in the IEEE-Open/LARC 2018, while he was the captain. He always has been very versatile and always looked forward to solve all the problems, although sometimes the problems weren't related to his area. He always defined clearly the team's priorities in order to accomplish the deadlines. He has deep knowledges in programming and hardware(embedded systems), being responsable of the most part of the robot's programming in IEEE-Open/LARC 2018.

Abdullah has managed to bring professors and students to work on a robot to compete at Latin American Robotics Competion. Other than that, has implemented agile methods similar to Kanban to organize the team in order to both meet deadlines and learn new technologies during the competition.

During the idealization and construction of the robot that would compete in LARC 2018 Abdullah has shown himself to be a great leader, allowing the team and himself to develop knowledge related to Mechatronics, specially embedded systems, all with great enthusiasm.
